intro: Indigofera griseoides subsp. griseoides, commonly known as the gray indigo, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and can grow up to several meters in height. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
